abstract.p: The Linear Modeling component allows users to conduct R lm, lmer, glm and glmer functions on a data file of their choice.

For glm and glmer, the variance and link families provided include: binomial (link = logit), binomial (link = probit), binomial (link = cloglog), gaussian (link = identity), Gamma (link = inverse), Gamma (link = identity), Gamma (link = log), inverse.gaussian (link = 1/mu^2), poisson (link = log), poisson (link = identity), poisson (link = sqrt).

Users can choose a column for response. For binomial families, the component will convert true/false and correct/incorrect/hint values to 1 or 0. For other families, the component only allows numeric values for response column.

The component provides convenient ways to users to construct formula for analysis. For lm/glm option, users can choose columns for fixed factor(s). For lmer/glmer, in addition to fixed factor(s), users can choose columns for random factor(s) with or without intercept, and with or without categorical nesting factor.
The back-end of the component runs on R.
To make glmer/lmer runs fast and efficiently, we apply glmerControl with nloptwrap as optimizer and lmerControl with optimx as optimizer.
To make glm/lm runs fast and efficiently, we use speedglm and speedlm respectively.

ul.li: A text file containing R analysis summary.
Modeling type: lm, lmer, glm or glmer.
Family: available only for glm or glmer.
Response: for binomial families, the component will convert true/false and correct/incorrect/hint values to 1 or 0. For other families, the component only allows numeric values for response column.

Fixed effects: can choose one or more factors at a time. Use the arrow buttons to edit the final fixed effects. If interaction type "*" is selected, all possible fixed factors will be added to the final list, thus the final formula. For example, KC*KC-opportunity results in three items KC, KC-opportunity and KC:KC-opportunity to be added to the final formula.

Random effects: grouping/random factor is required while nesting and independent/fixed factors are optional. For examples: choosing "student" as grouping/random factor alone results in (1+student) added to the final list; choosing "student" as grouping/random factor, "class" as nesting factor and "KC-opportunity" as independent/fixed factor results in (KC-opportunity|class/student) added to the final list. If "no" intercept is selected, (0+KC-opportunity|class/student) is added.
Formula: uneditable field. Content is constructed by what are selected in fixed effect and random effect fields.
Prediction Column Name: default is Predicted Error Rate (Linear Model)

p.b: Formula used for iAFM: First Attempt ~ Opportunity (A Model) + Opportunity (A Model)|Anon Student Id + Opportunity (A Model)|KC (A Model)

ol.li: First Attempt: Choose First Attempt for Response
Opportunity (A Model): In Fixed Effects, choose Opportunity (A Model) for Fixed factor
Opportunity (A Model)|Anon Student Id: In Random Effects, choose Anon Student Id for Grouping/Random factor, and choose Opportunity (A Model) for Independent/Fixed factor
Opportunity (A Model)|KC (A Model): In Random Effects, choose KC (A Model) for Grouping/Random factor, and choose Opportunity (A Model) for Independent/Fixed factor
Prediction Column Name: Predicted Error Rate (A Model)

p.b: Formula used for strong AFM: First Attempt ~ 1|Anon Student Id + KC (A Model) + KC (A Model):Opportunity (A Model)

ol.li: First Attempt: Choose First Attempt for Response
1|Anon Student Id: In Random Effects, choose Anon Student Id for Grouping/Random factor
KC (A Model): In Fixed Effects, choose KC (A Model) for Fixed factor
KC (A Model):Opportunity (A Model): In Fixed Effects, choose KC (A Model) and Opportunity (A Model) for Fixed factor, and choose ":" for interaction
Prediction Column Name: Predicted Error Rate (A Model)

p.b: Formula used for Hierarchical AFM: First Attempt ~ 1|Anon Student Id + 1|KC (A Model)/KC (Item Model) + KC (A Model):Opportunity (A Model)

ol.li: First Attempt: Choose First Attempt for Response
1|Anon Student Id: In Random Effects, choose Anon Student Id for Grouping/Random factor
1|KC (A Model)/KC (Item Model): In Random Effects, choose KC (Item Model) for Grouping/Random factor, and choose KC (A Model) for Nesting factor
KC (A Model):Opportunity (A Model): In Fixed Effects, choose KC (A Model) and Opprotunity (A Model) for Fixed factor; and choose ":" for interaction
Prediction Column Name: Predicted Error Rate (A Model)
